alert.note: Alert for Coastal Dixie; Inland Dixie; Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 3:04PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lafayette and Dixie Counties through 345 PM EST... At 304 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles east of Steinhatchee to near Cross City to near Horseshoe Point. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cross City, Shamrock, Hines, Cross City Airport, Old Town, Hatch Bend, Eugene, Fletcher, Guaranto Springs, Yellow Jacket, Fletcher Springs and Fanning Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
